definition: key (on a piano or computer keyboard)/button (on a mouse or other device)/chemical bond/linchpin

plate/dish/tray/board/hard drive (computing)/to build/to coil/to check/to examine/to transfer (property)/to make over/classifier for food: dish, helping/to coil/classifier for coils of wire/classifier for games of chess

sentences.english: The piano is a keyboard instrument with a history of over 200 years.
sentences.chinese: 鋼琴是一種鍵盤樂器，其歷史在二百年以上。

sentences.english: There are also early brass and keyboard instruments.
sentences.chinese: 這裏還有早期的銅管樂器和鍵盤樂器。

sentences.english: I play bass guitar — and keyboards!
sentences.chinese: 我是低音吉他手，我也玩鍵盤樂器。

sentences.english: She can play the piano and keyboard.
sentences.chinese: 她會彈鋼琴和鍵盤樂器。

definition: to notate music/to write a score
Handel (name)/George Frideric Handel (1685-1759), German-born Baroque composer, naturalized British in 1727
to make a fool of oneself
to spike the ball (volleyball etc)/to smash (tennis etc)
genre of song-and-dance duet popular in northeast China
hulusi, aka cucurbit flute (a kind of free reed wind instrument)
